column4: hi - I need to move my home folder to another partition, or maybe home and /usr - how do I do it without breaking the system?
you want to move it or just copy it?
I am running low on space on the part it is installed on
did you think maybe you could use the other partition to host all of your personal files to free up space in /home
i already have most of my personal files on a seperate part
well, it can be done. I wouldn't be confident enough to guide you because of the chance of failure (I don't want that over my head).
is there any way to resize the root partition while ubuntu is running?
yeah you can't resize beyond an extended partition
you are not in a good situation. It will be near impossible to resize your root partition without losing all your data, at least from what I am thinking your situation is
I have an extended with three parts in it, I want to delete one and extend another in to the empty space
oh, well delete the other partitions in the extended partition, and extend the root partition, should be fairly simple
the only reason I balked was because I thought you were trying to make the root partition  bigger than the extended partition, which obviously is troublesome
ok - will give that a try then - thanks
yes - it is hard to give a complete explanation in one sentence ;)
